rows.GRADE INFLATION DEFENSE — STRUCTURAL CHE: The grading system only works if grades have teeth. These are structural mechanisms to prevent midding.
If an Expert Reviewer gives everything a polite B+ to be nice, the entire verification layer is theater.
The risk is real. Experts are busy. They want to be helpful. Giving a C feels confrontational. The path of least resistance is "looks good."
A protocol that relies on hoping people are honest is not a protocol. It's a wish.
These structural checks make grade inflation detectable and correctable without relying on anyone's character.

rows.col_2: Expert gives 100% B or above across a full cluster (all TUPs in cluster)
rows.col_3: Secondary Expert Reviewer automatically assigned. Independent review of 2-3 TUPs from the cluster. If secondary grades ≥ 1 full letter lower on any TUP, primary grades are flagged for re-review.
rows.col_4: Conductor assigns secondary reviewer. Librarian routes TUPs.
rows.col_5: New guard condition on T45: IF primary_grade_distribution = 100%_B_or_above AND cluster_complete THEN trigger_secondary_review.

rows.col_2: End of each cluster's review cycle
rows.col_3: Librarian reports grade distribution for the cluster. Expected healthy distribution: 10-20% A, 50-60% B/B+, 20-30% C, 5-10% D/F. If actual distribution skews heavily toward B+/A, flag for review.
rows.col_4: Librarian generates report. Nilo reviews if flagged.
rows.col_5: Post-T45 audit. Does not block lock, but creates a record.

rows.col_3: Expert Reviewer's real name is permanently attached to every TUP they grade. "Graded by [Name], [Date], [Grade]." Their professional reputation is on the line.
rows.col_4: Librarian records on V-tab. Cannot be removed.
rows.col_5: V-tab schema requirement: grader_name, grader_date, grade, review_notes.

rows.col_3: Expert Reviewer cannot have a financial, personal, or professional relationship with the PM Co-Founder whose work they're grading. Conductor verifies independence at assignment.
rows.col_4: Conductor verifies at assignment. Declares any known conflicts.
rows.col_5: Pre-condition on S3→S4 transition: independence_verified = TRUE.

rows.col_3: Take one TUP that was graded B+ or above and send it to a DIFFERENT expert in the same domain, without revealing the original grade. Compare grades. If discrepancy > 1 full letter, investigate.
rows.col_4: Conductor selects TUP. Librarian routes to blind reviewer.
rows.col_5: Protocol-level audit. Not in state machine — runs in parallel.

rows.col_3: PM Co-Founder who produced a TUP cannot participate in grading it. Not even advisory. Total separation of production and verification.
rows.col_4: Enforced by Librarian routing. PM is not in the review distribution.
rows.col_5: Invariant: producer ≠ grader. Already implicit but now explicit.

rows.col_3: Expert must provide written review notes for every C-tab, not just an overall grade. "B" with no notes is rejected. Forces engagement with actual content.
rows.col_4: Librarian rejects V-tabs with grade but no per-tab notes.
rows.col_5: V-tab schema: per_tab_notes required. Grade without notes = incomplete review.

rows.col_3: D grade: PM equity at risk for that sprint. F grade: PM equity forfeited for that sprint. Post-mortem required. This is not theoretical — it must actually happen at least once to establish precedent.
rows.col_4: Nilo confirms forfeiture. Logged in Equity Protocol.
rows.col_5: T42 (return to production) for C. Forfeiture logged for D/F.

rows.GRADE INFLATION DEFENSE — STRUCTURAL CHE: WHAT "MIDDING" LOOKS LIKE vs WHAT REAL GRADING LOOKS LIKE

rows.col_2: 90%+ B or above. Zero Cs. Zero Ds.

rows.col_3: Per-tab notes citing specific claims, gaps, or errors.
10-20 hours for cluster. Actually read the tabs.
At least 20-30% of TUPs get returned for revision on first pass.
Expert challenges assumptions, cites competing evidence, marks "not attested" on specific claims.
Triggered at least once. Precedent established. People know it's real.

rows.GRADE INFLATION DEFENSE — STRUCTURAL CHE: If the first cluster comes back with 100% B+ grades, zero remediation, and 2-hour review time — the grading system is fake.
The defense mechanisms above make grade inflation DETECTABLE. But detection requires someone who is willing to ACT on it.
That person is Nilo. If you see the midding signals and don't intervene, the protocol is theater regardless of what's written here.
The structural defenses buy you time and evidence. The willingness to use them is on you.
